item.title: A Geometrically Driven Swarm Algorithm Enhanced with Obstacle Avoidance
item.description:
A joint research project about swarms coordination algorithm that can models deformable-body movement in 2D & also avoiding obstacles while moving towards a target, during an internship at M&MoCS research center in Italy.

  • Lagrangian modeling of the swarm
  • Developing an obstacle avoidance algorithm
  • Investigating the Poisson effect on the stability of the swarm
  • Autonomous trajectory planning in a field of obstacles
  • Coding and simulation using Wolfram Mathematica

item.title: Hybrid ROV-AUV Design
item.description:
A group project for desiging an underwater vehicle for industrial needs. This bio-inspired design combines the capabilities of a conventional ROV with perks of AUVs. Some notable features of this design project:

  • Detailed CAD design
  • Modular and robust design
  • Multi-purpose design with high-end sensors
  • Simulated and hydrostatic and hydrodynamic analysis using ANSYS
  • Diffrent Control Modes for various underwater opperations with increased stability and maneuverability

item.title: Temperature Controller Device
item.description: This is an ongoing project being carried out during a hands-on course on designing an electronic circuit and programming an ARM microcontroller to control a temperature chamber. The temperature of the chamber is being measured using various sensors, such as PTC, NTC, and PT100, and controlled through relays turning the heater on and off. LCD and keypad are also implemented to change the settings of the controller. Currently, the first section of the course on electronic circuit design using Altium Designer has been completed, and we are working on programming the STM32F103RBT6 microcontroller.

item.title: Temperature Controller Device
item.description:
This project was carried out during the “Embedded Systems” hands-on course to design an electronic circuit and programming an ARM microcontroller to control a temperature chamber. The following topics have been covered during this course:

  • ARM Microcontrollers Architecture
  • Design Circuits for Power Supply - Linear/Switching Regulators
  • Design Circuits for Digital InputOutput
  • Design Circuits for Analog Input/Output - Protection Circuit
  • Keypad and LCD Interfacing
  • RS485 Communication Interface
  • STM32 Programming - GPIO, DMA, ADC, USART, Interrupts
  • LCD and Keypad Interface Programming
  • HMI Communication - Modbus Protocol

item.title: UR5 Robot Kinematic Modelling & Control Simulation
item.description:
Modeling and Motion Control of a redundant manipulator, on kinematic Level, with 6 DOFs and 3-dimensional task space, tracking specific spatial trajectories.

  • Direct kinematics and Jacobian analysis
  • Simulating kinematics of the robot using Matlab and Simulink
  • Using live-link connection with V-REP to visualize the Robot and its end-effector trajectory
  • Inverse kinematic controller, using Jacobian pseudo-inverse with active null space
  • Programmed trajectories: rectilinear, circular, and helix
